title.narrative: Assessment of Colombia Brucellosis National eradication program and Capacity Development Strategy and technical capacity building workshop

description.narrative: From September 4-10, 2016, the Assessment of the Columbian Brucellosis National Eradication Program was held in Columbia. APHIS Conducted an evaluation visit and provided advice for one week to Colombia by two Subject Matter Experts on the issue of control and eradication of bovine and bubaline brucellosis

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Caribbean - 2016 Plant Quarantine Principles and Procedures Course

description.narrative: The overall objective of this initiative is to safeguard the Caribbean Region from the entry and establishment of exotic plant pests, as well as to manage any outbreaks that may occur, through the strengthening of regional phytosanitary capabilities and capacities and, in particular, through improved training in the principles and procedures of plant quarantine.

title.narrative: Food for Progress

description.narrative: The Food for Progress Program provides for the donation of U.S. agricultural commodities to developing countries and emerging democracies that are committed to introducing or expanding free enterprise in their agricultural economies. The program has two primary strategic objectives: (1) increase agricultural productivity and (2) expand trade of agricultural products.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles
